page.title: 08FARMING IN APPLETON WISKE
page.content: MR WILLIAM ATKINSON OF VILLAGE FARM, FRONT STREET APPLETON WISKE IS TYPICAL OF THE FARMERS IN THE AREA. HE HAS A 52 ACRE MIXED FARM. HE KEEPS 52 PEDIGREE DAIRY SHORTORN COWS AND 65 PEDIGREE LARGE WHITE PIGS HIS FIELDS ARE NOT ALL TOGETHER BUT ARE SEPARATED BY OTHER FIELDS. HIS LARGEST FIELD IS 6 ACRES HIS SMALLEST 1 ACRE. UP TO 1959 HIS COWS WERE MILKED BY HAND AND UP TO 1942 HIS LAND WAS WORKED BY HORSES. THIS YEAR HE HAS GROWN 3 ACRES OF WINTER WHEAT, 2 ACRES SPRING CORN, 1.5 ACRES OF MANGLES, TURNIPS AND KALE FOR CATTLE FEED, 25 ACRES OF HAY (MEADOW GRASS) AND 20.5 ACRES FOR GRAZING. HE WORKS A 12 HOUR DAY AND AT BUSY TIMES HE EMPLOYS A PART TIME WORKER. NOWADAYS HE USES A LOT OF MACHINERY INCLUDING TWO TRACTORS, A PLOUGH, 2 HAY TURNERS, BAILER, ROWING BODY, CULTIVATER, WUFFLER, FERTILISER
